text: Edward Jarvis FRAI FRAS (born 1975) is a British author of social and religious history, religion and politics, and theology. His academic studies of the Brazilian Catholic Apostolic Church (ICAB) and the lives of Carlos Duarte Costa and Ngô Đình Thục were the first ever systematic scholarly monographs on those subjects.Mauro Castagnaro (foreword) in E. Jarvis, Carlos Duarte Costa: testament of a socialist bishop, Apocryphile Press, Berkeley CA, 2019, p. 7."The Vagrant Vicar", 5 October 2018, https://vagrantvicar.blogspot.com/2018/10/ | "The Vagrant Vicar", 5 January 2019, https://vagrantvicar.blogspot.com/2019/01/book-review-sede-vacante-life- and.html | "The Vagrant Vicar", 27 August 2019, https://vagrantvicar.blogspot.com/2019/08/book-review-carlos-duarte-costa.html accessed 27 August 2019 They have contributed to the historically very small body of academic literature on the paradoxically widespread (and growing)Julie Byrne, The Other Catholics: remaking America's largest religion, Columbia University Press, New York, 2016, pp. 5-7.Joe Strupp, New Jersey Monthly, https://njmonthly.com/articles/jersey-living/american-national-catholic- church-nj/ accessed 28 July 2019 phenomenon of Independent Catholicism,John P. Plummer, The Many Paths of the Independent Sacramental Movement, Apocryphile Press, Berkeley CA, 2006, pp 3-4, 6, 10 and the relatively limited body of scholarship on Vietnamese Catholicism.Tuan Hoang, "Ultramontanism, Nationalism, and the Fall of Saigon: Historicizing the Vietnamese American Catholic Experience" in American Catholic Studies, Volume 130, Iss. 1, Spring 2019, pp 1-6. https://works.bepress.com/tuannyriver/4/ accessed 28 July 2019 ==Early life and education== Edward Jarvis was born in Kingston upon Hull, England, in 1975, to an English father and an Italian mother.GRO Births 1975, https://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?scan=1&r;=253525234:5688&d;=bmd_1564415191 accessed 29 August 2019 His great-grandfather was the Italian film actor Umberto Sclanizza. Jarvis attended the Malet Lambert School before studying theology and religious studies at Trinity & All Saints College (B.A.), York St John (M.A.), and the Logos Institute of Theology (Th.D.). He lectured in contemporary religious ethics at Liverpool Hope University and later worked at Durham University's Centre for Catholic Studies.'Catholic Perspectives on Poverty', Centre for Catholic Studies, Durham University, https://www.dur.ac.uk/theology.religion/ccs/new/?itemno=23336 | Nigel Baker, HM Ambassador to the Holy See, Centre for Catholic Studies, Durham University, https://www.dur.ac.uk/theology.religion/ccs/new/?itemno=23882 | 'Catholic Theology Research Seminar', https://www.stcuthberts-durham.org.uk/archives/627 accessed 9 July 2019 ==Work== Ten years of research resulted in the first ever biography of Brazilian bishop Carlos Duarte Costa, and God, Land & Freedom: the true story of ICAB, the first full-length historical, theological, and anthropological study of the Brazilian Catholic Apostolic Church (ICAB) to appear in its 75-year history. This work has been called "engaging and informative ... provocative and stimulating"Paul Dean, 'Book Reviews', RENEW, No. 189, March 2019, p 17 https://www.ccc4vat2.org.uk/ccc25/magazine/older- editions accessed 7 July 2019 among other positive responses.Mauro Castagnaro (foreword) in E. RENEW, past editions collection, (No. 186) https://www.ccc4vat2.org.uk/ccc25/magazine/older-editions/1-renew-older- editions accessed 9 July 2019 He is also the first and only biographer (to date) of the Vietnamese archbishop Ngô Đình Thục, influential brother of President Ngô Đình Diệm, and he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Asiatic Society (FRAS) in 2019.RAS, List of Fellows https://royalasiaticsociety.org/list-of-fellows/ accessed 3 October 2019 He was also elected a Fellow of the Royal Anthropological Institute (FRAI).Royal Anthropological Institute, Directory of Fellows https://suite.nomadit.co.uk/directory.php5?organisation=5 accessed 27 August 2019 ==Selected bibliography== * * * ==References== ==External links== * Independent Catholic Heritage Series, http://apocryphilepress.com/book- series/independent-catholic-heritage-series/ Category:Living people Category:1975 births Category:People from Kingston upon Hull Category:English people of Italian descent Category:British historians of religion Category:English Christian theologians Category:Catholic Worker Movement Category:Academics of Durham University Category:Alumni of Leeds Trinity University Category:Fellows of the Royal Anthropological Institute of Great Britain and Ireland
